title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the +Q charge (F1 as drawn above)

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the -Q charge (F2 as drawn above)
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the +Q charge (F1 as drawn above)

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the -Q charge (F2 as drawn above)

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the +Q charge (F1 as drawn above)

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the -Q charge (F2 as drawn above)

The student earns two of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the +Q charge (F1 as drawn above)

1 point(s) earned: For indicating the correct direction for the force due to the -Q charge (F2 as drawn above)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned : For any indication that the magnitudes of F 1 and F 2 are the same

The x-components of F 1 and F 2 cancel.

1 point(s) earned : For any indication that the magnitude of the net force is the sum of the y-components of F 1 and F 2 , which are equal

1 point(s) earned : For a correct expression for cosθ

cos θ = d x 2 + d 2

1 point(s) earned : For a correct substitution for F into the above expression for F total

F = k q Q r 2 = k q Q x 2 + d 2 F t o t a l = 2 k q Q x 2 + d 2 d x 2 + d 2

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the total force

F t o t a l =   2 k q Q d ( x 2 + d 2 ) 3 / 2 or equivalent

1 point(s) earned : For indicating the correct direction for the total force, e.g., negative y-direction, toward the bottom of the page, etc.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The field can be found from the force.

E = F total / q

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the electric field

E = 2 k Q d ( x 2 + d 2 ) 3 / 2

1 point(s) earned : For indicating the correct direction for the electric field, e.g., negative y-direction, toward the bottom of the page, etc.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

The field can be found from the force.

E = F total / q

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the electric field

E = 2 k Q d ( x 2 + d 2 ) 3 / 2

1 point(s) earned : For indicating the correct direction for the electric field, e.g., negative y-direction, toward the bottom of the page, etc.

The student earns one of the following points:

The field can be found from the force.

E = F total / q

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the electric field

E = 2 k Q d ( x 2 + d 2 ) 3 / 2

1 point(s) earned : For indicating the correct direction for the electric field, e.g., negative y-direction, toward the bottom of the page, etc.

The student earns two of the following points:

The field can be found from the force.

E = F total / q

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the electric field

E = 2 k Q d ( x 2 + d 2 ) 3 / 2

1 point(s) earned : For indicating the correct direction for the electric field, e.g., negative y-direction, toward the bottom of the page, etc.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The total potential is the sum of the individual point charge potentials.

E = F total / q

1 point(s) earned : For the correct magnitude of the electric field

V = V 1 + V 2 = k Q x 2 + d 2 + − k Q x 2 + d 2

1 point(s) earned : For indicating that the electric potential is zero

Note: One point partial credit could be earned for only recognizing that the potentials from the two charges must be added.
descriptions:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned : For any indication that as x gets large, the hypotenuse and x are approximately equal or d is negligible compared to x

1 point(s) earned : For indicating that the above implies that x 2 + d 2 ≈ x

1 point(s) earned : For indicating that substituting the approximate equality into the answer from part (b) yields

F t o t a l = 2 k q Q d x 3
